result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined. 
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Davis

records.addlTxt:
2:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher J Davis in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Christopher J Davis.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Rockow relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

Court costs including DNA surcharge - 60 DTP
Order for DNA given to defendant in court.  Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher J Davis in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Christopher J Davis.
Attorney Rockow requests to reset.  Next hearing to be in person.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continued.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher J Davis in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Christopher J Davis. 
Formal reading of Complaint waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues. Plea date set and must appear in person.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold for consumption on the premises.
Must sign bond by end of this week.
Must appear in person for 7/08/2022 hearing.

10:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher J Davis appeared by video. 

Public Defender has not yet been appointed to represent Christopher.
Defendant pleads NG.
Hearing set; must appear in person for next hearing.
